unit_learning_outcomes.description: write clear and cogent reports, assessing environmental quality matters for management and public audiences
explain the fundamental principles of environmental pollution and impacts on health
responsibly work in a team to collaboratively assess environmental problems of real life industrial emissions
collect and interpret raw data in environmentally significant terms
demonstrate modelling skills for environmental impact assessment of pollutant emissions

assessments.description: The quizzes will test knowledge and may be online or in-class. See iLearn for a detailed list of quizzes in this unit.
The quizzes will test knowledge and may be online or in-class. See iLearn for a detailed list of quizzes in this unit.
The project will involve modeling and assessment of environmental impacts of industrial operations.
This assessment will consist of preparing a consulting report assessing environmental pollution data of a case study.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances, North Ryde

academic_org.value: Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences

data.description: This unit focuses on the chemical and physical aspects of environmental pollution in the air and water. It explores how a number of major chemical pollutants are released into the environment, how they react, move and impact the environment and human health. The presentation is set in a context of the science and management of air and water quality. The unit includes treatment of problems in air pollution, global atmospheric change, water pollution and the water resources of Australia.
data.title: Environmental Pollution
